Bondi Beach shooting in Sydney kills 16, Australian PM decries 'act of antisemitism'
subhead: The attack took place during an annual 'Hanukkah by the Sea' event in Australia's largest city. Police declared it a 'terrorist incident' and said they had found suspected 'improvised explosive devices' linked to one of the alleged shooters, who was killed.

Filippo Grandi, UN High Commissioner for Refugees: 'We live in a world unable to make peace'
subhead: In January, Grandi will step down from his position, with former Iraqi president Barham Salih set to succeed him. In an interview with Le Monde, he reflects on the crises that have marked his ten-year tenure: Ukraine, Sudan, Syria and more.

title: A meat-forward restaurant and an exclusive club for the rich: The Washington of Trump loyalists
subhead: Since being elected, Donald Trump has sought to assert his dominance over the US capital, historically a Democratic stronghold. His supporters have claimed several locations in the city, including a restaurant, an evangelical church and a club for the ultra-wealthy.

title: Mory Sacko, the calm celebrity chef: 'I have no score to settle with life'
subhead: He rose to fame on 'Top Chef' in 2020 and has since become a charismatic figure in France's new wave of gastronomy. At the helm of Mosuke, his Michelin-starred restaurant in Paris, Mory Sacko has created a small culinary empire built on joy and serenity.

title: Franco-German children of war's endless search for their roots
subhead: In France, between 1941 and 1945, around 200,000 children are estimated to have been born from a union between a French woman and a German soldier. Their often painful search for their origins meets many obstacles, including family taboos and difficult access to archives.

The forgotten war between France and Cameroon
subhead: Historians comment on seven photographs that bear witness to the crimes committed by France in the African country between 1955 and 1971.

title: Paris region inaugurates its first cable car
subhead: The C1 cable car line opened on December 13, connecting the south-eastern Paris suburbs of Créteil and Villeneuve-Saint-Georges. This new mode of urban transport is attracting the interest of many local governments.

title: How the Israeli army is razing the part of Gaza it is supposed to withdraw from
subhead: Despite the ceasefire that was declared on October 10, Israel has continued to raze many buildings east of the 'yellow line' in the Gaza Strip, according to local residents and satellite images of the enclave.
byline: Elsa Delmas,  Marie Jo Sader and  Mellit Derre
